testcaseName: Patient is 5 years of age and is administered Pfizer's Covid-19 (CVX219) vaccine as a first dose.

administeredDoses.vaccineName: Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine (EUA labeled)  COMIRNATY (BLA labeled)
administeredDoses.evaluationReason: Not a preferable or allowable vaccine

doses.vaccineName: Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine (EUA labeled)  COMIRNATY (BLA labeled)
doses.evaluationReason: Not a preferable or allowable vaccine

generalDescription: This test cases describes when a patient who is 5 years of age and is administered Pfizer's (CVX Code 219) Covid-19 vaccine as his first dose, that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast immediately.
reasonForChange: v4.25 - Updated test case based on clarification from Covid-19 SME concerning age limits for CVX Code 219 (maroon cap). The 6 mo - 4 year Pfizer can be considered valid for those between the ages of 5 years and 6 years, but ONLY IF dose one is administered before 5 years. Dose 1 of CVX 219 can not be administered on/after 5 years of age. Subsequent doses can be administered on/after 5 years of age.
